title: Poster, "Specimen", 2008
provenance: Fanette Mellier; October 2012: acquired by Museum
description: Poster depicts tapestry of printer's marks with text on lower left verso to be folded up on right side for exhibition purposes.
justification: The Specimen poster was featured in the Graphic Design Now exhibition and is depicted on the catalogue’s cover.&nbsp; Particularly engaging is the way the dog-earned lower right corner is folded back to reveal the poster’s text advertising a series of exhibitions on editorial design in 2008 in the town of Chaumont, France.&nbsp; To the average viewer the tapestry of colorful geometric signs resembles a diagram of a microchip.&nbsp; To the initiated graphic designer, however, these symbols are recognizable as the various printers’ control marks.&nbsp; According to Mellier, she decided to print the text on the folded corner because she didn’t want it to interrupt the tapestry like effect and to force the viewer to fold the paper to get the information.&nbsp;&nbsp; The poster won second prize at the 2011 Chaumont Poster Festival.

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "Specimen", 2008. Offset lithograph on paper. Gift of Fanette Mellier. 2013-18-1.
